remarks: Jump discontinuity or discontinuity of the first kind: if the left and the right limit don't match, the function is discontinuous at the point.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
jumpncnp.k $e |- K = ( TopOpen ` CCfld ) $.
jumpncnp.a $e |- ( ph -> A C_ RR ) $.
jumpncnp.3 $e |- J = ( topGen ` ran (,) ) $.
jumpncnp.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> CC ) $.
jumpncnp.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
jumpncnp.lpt1 $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( ( limPt ` J ) ` ( A i^i ( -oo (,) B ) ) ) ) $.
jumpncnp.lpt2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( ( limPt ` J ) ` ( A i^i ( B (,) +oo ) ) ) ) $.
jumpncnp.8 $e |- ( ph -> L e. ( ( F |` ( -oo (,) B ) ) limCC B ) ) $.
jumpncnp.9 $e |- ( ph -> R e. ( ( F |` ( B (,) +oo ) ) limCC B ) ) $.
jumpncnp.lner $e |- ( ph -> L =/= R ) $.
jumpncnp $p |- ( ph -> -. F e. ( ( J CnP ( TopOpen ` CCfld ) ) ` B ) ) $.
